Nothing Earth shattering here, but this is a solid album. Pros: - New James 
Taylor music - Nothing too new (not a departure from the classic James 
style). Evokes good memories. - At least a 3 songs which are infinitely 
singable and/or whimsical enough to bear repeated listenings - Sting and Yo 
Yo Ma actually make good additions/contributions without being either 
irrelevant or overwhelming . Cons: - He sounds old and that makes me sad. 
He has definitely lost some diction over the years. - Nothing too new (not 
a departure from the classic James style). Leaves you wishing for something 
a little more. Summary: If you are a James Taylor fan, definitely worth it. 
This album brings on nostalgia like no one's business while still giving 
something to which you can listen. If you are not a JT fan and Tanglewood 
isn't your scene, this might not be the best place to start your 
infatuation with a great artist.

Huge fan After seeing James Taylor on Jimmy Fallon show, I had to get the album.

you're Australian, be Australian!' Sounds like an over-the-top American cartoon. Stronger American accent

Audible Art! This is not an album for the casual music fan. This is a graduate course 
where Professor Micheal Eugene Archer recaps nearly a century of music 
history in original masterpieces. Using religion, politics, sex, love, and 
race as templates to showcase the value of "dead" forms of music (funk, 
rock, quartet gospel, even showtunes). The lyrics are deeply thought out 
without trying to be deep in some "hey look how poetic I am" kinda of 
writing style. I could write an entire essay on this album and I just 
might!

Part 2 of the album Voodoo This dude came back like he never left! Music in it's purest form. People 
please understand that his vocals are low ON PURPOSE. That's why he 
released a lyric book right after his album dropped. He was conveying 
messages that he wanted you to look up and read. I gotta give it 5 stars. D 
is in beast mode on this one. I dare anyone to play the whole album Voodoo 
then play this whole album behind it. It's like you're listening to part 2 
of Voodoo only he never released the songs until now. HOTNESS D!

Classic on its own terms Black Messiah is not like Voodoo but just like its predecessor it stands 
alone....The music is funky and still has an old school 70' s feel.. Aint 
that Easy, Sugah Daddy. Real LOVE and my favorite Another Life all examples 
of good soulful music...I admit you will have to repeat the album several 
times and even look up lyrics but the album will grow on you. In a world 
where almost everything we hear is commercial and slick we need to some 
music that makes you take notice...album will be nominated for Grammy

Almost perfect. Nothing wrong with the songs at all, other than the fact that the way most 
are mixed. It's a bit harder to hear D'Angelo's voice clearly like on 
Voodo, but I fault the mixing/mastering engineer than D'Angelo. Overall, 
he's back!! The music seems new and fresh, and groovy and familiar all at 
the same time. "Really Love" is my jam though. I had that on repeat about 
10 or 12 times. Outstanding return to form D'Angelo. Your music was surely 
missed. Can't want for the next one.

Absolutely Incredible Musicianship!!! Album blows my mind...never heard anything like it. Quite like my father 
describing the first time he heard Marvin Gaye really do his own thing! 
D'angelo and the Vanguard really make you feel each vocal and instrument. 
Listen on hq speakers btw

Dope Album is crazy. If u dig "neo soul" then this is one u definitely cannot 
miss. Complaints about the sound are simply a result him not using digital 
but instead recording on 2 inch tape… this is what gives it that old school 
gritty true soulful sound, its just we arent used to hearing it anymore. 
Super Dope, welcome back D. Welcome back.

Dangerously close to Voodoo. The man is back! And he brought real music back with him. It's been almost 
15 years since voodoo dropped and it left me and so many wanting more soul 
from Mr d'angelo. This album brings a familiar voice with quite a new sound 
but still reminiscent of D from back in the days. For me.. Voodoo is still 
my all time favorite album. A masterpiece. Black Messiah is a close second 
with brown sugar. If yall want real music and been longing for it for so 
long.. Wait no more. It's here.

Back with a vengeance The best album of 2015. Deep and murky and full of soul. Yes it's clear 
he's still obsessed with Prince (that's a plus) because this sounds like 
Parade in its production. But that lp happens to be Princes best 
production. Enough about Prince. D'Angelo has been gone for a decade and 
came back on top of R&B.Besides Badu and Miguel no one comes close to 
touching this.Every single song is perfect.Aint that easy is the most 
perfect though :-)

Repeat champion Does my heart good to see that D hasn't missed a step musically & 
artistically. It's like he won the chip & never left the court, still in 
the zone. Game 6 flu game ish!!!

Instant classic If everyone else's albums were. this good, I'd wait 14 years for theirs, 
too. It's clear D'Angelo wanted to make a lasting statement of the 
struggle, and he did so in a way nobody else could. Credit due to 
Questlove, Q-Tip, Kendra Foster, Pino Palladino and everyone else working 
behind the scenes to bring this to the world. But especially thank you to 
D'Angelo for allowing us all to bear witness.

Black Messiah I thought real music and musicianship had died...I was wrong. This album 
is funkier than three day old sweaty sweat socks and sweeter than honey. 
Welcome back D'Angelo, I will be in the front row when you come to Chicago!

If You cant say something positive I've read some of the reviews and i have to say. This is not a time to 
give bad reviews to any of the artists that we know are better than this BS 
out here today. The Album is Needed and i like it for the music not the 
production. I didn't judge this as a engineer. I just loved to see him back 
after listening to music with no soul for the past few years. With no radio 
play for anyone like this we need to big up this return and leave the 
criticism for pop stars. Thanks D Welcome back we love you.

Masterpiece I was half sleep and heard Really Love playing on WBLS in NY. I actually 
got up and went to the.playlist to find out who it was. Then I listened to 
snipets of the whole album. Was blown away. A guitarist myself this album 
is some raw funk. A mix between Prince and gifted gospel singer Tonex is 
the nearest but then again hard to classify. A CLASSIC to me. And I don't 
go around writing reviews. Julian Shamir Green NY.

Funk to a Fault Sounds like a bunch of confusion. True D'Angelo will still hear his sound 
at the heart of these noisy and chaotic melodies, but not enough of it to 
make you satisfied with his return. Really Love is the only audibly 
pleasing song on this LP. The return of D'Angelo is an even bigger 
disappointment than the return of Lauryn Hill (Live). Where have our R&B 
Heroes & Heroines gone?

Classic Music I am blown away by this new release! It is real R&B music that takes you 
on an introspective soul journey. Go online for a lyric sheet. My favorite 
songs are Sugah Daddy and Another Life.

Dee Chaney.. Another Life......hit me right in the soul!!... Yeah, there are some 
tracks I can do without but overall, I am happy to see a brother back in 
the game!!! I already have my favs so cant wait for the tour!!

Perfect timing for Black Messiah album This album can't listen to on cheap ear buds, or lame computer speakers. 
You need a quality sound system or headphones might have to use an 
equalizer too or will believe this album is poorly mixed. This album 
reminds of back in the day when your in a smoky dim light lounge with a 
band and great vocalist. They were in the moment had fun no rules just 
authentic unapologetic soulful jams. Artists are supposed to take you on a 
journey and out of your comfort zone. Music nowadays plays it too safe and 
chases the radio. It supposed to be other way around shake things up plus 
stay true to yourself. This is what the music industry needs. Feels like 
perfect holiday gift plus way to start the new year.

14 Years later.... Only reason I'm not 5 staring it is because i can't understand half of 
what he's saying. Lest it's mixed purposely like There's a Riot goin On and 
Exile On Main St in which one has to employ their treble/eq to bring out 
high end to hear lyrics, but i did that and it helped...a little bit. 
Otherwise he didn't disappoint. I was SO worried that the wait would be a 
bust, but no, it's a solid lp. Now I'm wondering why he took so long, and 
hopefully he won't do it again.

Too long awaited I think it's time for some of his type flavor this type of soul is dying. 
Beautiful ballads with really love & betray my heart but he loses a lot of 
his voice with the arrangements & mixes in this album. Still on top of his 
game with the lay off but if he want to stay relevant bless us with more 
with less time between albums.

Return of the Real Music Black Messiah is like the slow, simmered home cook meal you would get at 
your grandmother's house-a huge welcome from the "fast-food" music we've 
been spoon fed for so many years! Welcome back D'angelo

Awesome Bday Gift to Me!! D has done it again with this infectiously addictive album..beautifully 
arranged and exquisitely well put together! He woke up the dead of R&B with 
this one here!! And it came out on my birthday lol well done D'Angelo!! 
#VAAllDay #BlackMessiah

Great Body of work This is a great body of work. Most importantly it's feel good and 
conscious messages are present. Yes the vocals are low, but I almost feel 
like this is deliberate. He's allowed the vocals blend into the groves of 
the song. There are definitely some similarities with Voodoo here, so 
anybody trying to make an excuse for vocals, as to why they 'hate' this 
album are simply trying to downplay good music. Where living in a different 
time an age now, where there is allot of 'fake hype', but it just feels so 
relevant and classic at the same time. I think it just had to happen, we 
needed it. Very few artists now, are been able to create quality music on 
this level, but I feel like this album has or can be 'the icebreaker' to 
innovation in what has become a very stagnant and elitist music industry. 5 
for effort!

Inaudible I couldn't wait for this album to drop, now I wish he had spent more time 
on it. If it wasn't for sugah daddy I would say the whole thing was a 
waisted effort. Sorry D'angelo this album is a miss!

Well worth the wait This album is perfect. I get lost in the music. It literally seems to make 
my body move. Beautifully Funky album!!!

D'Angelo is an exceptional Artist! This album is just as good as "Brown sugar" & "Voodoo". My favorite songs 
right now are Another Life, Really Love & Betray my Heart. D'Angelo keep up 
the good work! I am a fan for life....

Only In My Opinion!!! As much as I love him & his music. I can't understand 
any words nor can I relate. And there are a lot of Prince samples. Yet I'm 
a true fan and love love Love his music!

D...I love you & you can do no wrong in my eyes but... This album wasn't it for me. I'd much rather here his sensually melodic 
voice over a mellow beat rather than straining to hear him over purposeful 
chaos. My opinion.

D'Angelo-Black Messiah Chile I know you been gone for over 10 yes but when you said you was gonna 
bring it I didn't know you meant like this.. Lawda have mercy!!

Album of the year! Poignant, soulful messages buried in appallingly complex sonic textures. 
Few albums are capable of being timeless and and timely all at once but 
Black Messiah feels effortlessly classic, immediate, and prescient. A 
masterstroke when we needed it most.

Worth the wait! Solid! Not as cohesive as Voodoo but like Voodoo it can be played end to 
end no filler, and you'll be hitting rewind again! Oh, the last track 
"another life" freaking incredible!

Prince wannabe Even in his hey day you could hear the Prince overtones in his music, in 
fact when I heard his hit "how does it feel" I swore it was Prince. I 
recently saw D'Angelo perform on some show and you can REALLY see (in his 
mind)...he thinks he's Prince lol...wearing long trench coats, bandanna's 
on his head, playing a guitar and his mannerisms lol...all 
Prince-izims...old Prince-izims at that lol

Love D'Angelo BEEN A FAN FOR THE LONGEST. I'm glad that his music and his sound has not 
changed. That was my only worry but he's consistent with this album

DID THE DAM THING! THIS is REAL music! I'll admit, I was concerned that he might have been 
gone too long...BUT, he came back STRONG! Now, when I say "REAL" music, I 
mean, THAT is where the attention to this album is! Bravo! "Lyrics hard to 
hear"?? So what!! It's the MUSIC!!! Something the industry has been MISSING 
for some time now! Masterful album D'Angelo, you did the DAM thing!

The Best Album 2014 Hands down this album puts a lot of artist to shame. It's been 14yrs since 
the last album and now another masterpiece. WOW!!!!!! Only one holding in 
down for VA and R&B.

I don't know what the hell this is Everyone is praising this album as genius, and I just don't get it. It's

Cannot groove to this at all!

Hated It I'm sorry but what the h... happen to him.He wait that long for that.Come

This was a second a listen album. I was not impressed at first, I think 
partially due to my own aversion to anything I deem as overhyped...Now I 
have been playing it nonstop!! I am a huge D'Angelo fan and this is a 
breath of fresh air for R&B. Black Messiah lives up to, and beyond the 
hype. This is truly a very timely classic. Thank you D'Angelo for sharing 
your world with us!

Amazing Awesome! I've always been a fan of D'Angelo! I expected to hear greatness 
as soon as I found out he dropped a new Album! I hope he does not make us 
wait another 1000 years...that's what it felt like!

Sorely Disappointed Firstly, let me establish that I'm a long time fan of D'Angelo's music 
since his Brown Sugar debut. So to say that this album was a complete 
let-down for me is an understatement. The main problem lies in its 
repetitive overuse of the typical multilayered vocals that has become 
D'Angelo's signature sound. A far cry from Voodoo, his neo-funk 
masterpiece, Black Messiah seems to emulate some of its loosely structured 
musical style, yet suffers from a cacophonic redundancy that makes good 
listening difficult.

Solid... This album is everything I wanted it to be... My only 2 critiques: 1) The 
lyrics are hard to make out here and there but I've noticed that throughout 
history of soul music's greatest entertainers - the harder to decipher, the 
heavier the message. I wonder if it's on purpose especially considering 
that's not an oversight the people involved would have. Can a brotha get 
some liner notes lol. Still jammin regardless... 2) The mix/master isn't A1 
but it's still solid... you won't be disappointed. Another Life, Prayer, 
and Really Love are my personal standouts (for now) but I can play this 
album beginning to end (and have several times already lol). Only reason 
it's not 5 is because of the muddled lyrics on certain records and the mix 
but they're far from deal breakers. I'll be bumping this one for a while.

Love it!!! Took me a while to get into and really appreciate each song, but it was 
definitely worthwhile! I saw the album cover on iTunes a couple of years 
ago and thought that it was 2 old people making old people songs... I was

Aphex Twin should step up and snatch every award just to show how pathetic 
and incapable people are in creativity and representation.
